title: Ministry issues draft guidelines on establishing EV charging infrastructure under PM E-DRIVE - BusinessLine
summary:
Ministry Issues Draft Guidelines for EV Charging Infrastructure

Date & Source: Updated - December 30, 2024 at 01:34 PM, The Hindu Business Line

Introduction: The Ministry of Heavy Industries (MHI) has issued draft guidelines for setting up electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure under the Prime Minister Electric Drive Revolution in Innovative Vehicle Enhancement (PM E-DRIVE) Scheme.

  1. The scheme aims to set up over 22,000 EV chargers for electric four wheelers and 1,800 chargers for e-buses.
  2. It also includes provisions for charging infrastructure for light EVs like electric two-wheelers and electric three-wheelers.
  3. The government aims to involve various stakeholders, including charge point operators, EV charger manufacturers, and other government bodies.
  4. The scheme offers an 80% subsidy on upstream infrastructure, with an outlay of ₹2,000 crore.

Notable Quote: According to the draft guidelines, central-level Ministries and State governments are encouraged to carry out feasibility studies to identify suitable locations for EV charging stations.

Conclusion: The draft guidelines for EV charging infrastructure aim to expand public charging facilities, involving various stakeholders and offering significant subsidies to promote EV adoption in India.
newTitle: India's Ministry Issues Draft Guidelines for Expanding EV Charging Infrastructure

title: Apple discontinues iPhone 14, iPhone SE in EU as USB-C becomes mandatory - Business Standard
summary:
Apple Discontinues iPhone 14 and iPhone SE in EU Due to USB-C Regulations

Date: Dec 30 2024 | Source: Business Standard

In response to new regulations mandating USB-C connectors, Apple has stopped selling iPhone 14 and iPhone SE models in the European Union, while these models remain available in other regions including India.

  • The EU required all electronic devices to adopt USB-C by December 28.
  • Apple's new iPhone 15 series uses USB-C, but earlier models with Lightning connectors are discontinued in the EU.
  • iPhones are still sold in markets outside the EU, like India.
Apple might phase out its Lightning connectors completely with future iPhone releases.

This shift indicates Apple's alignment with regulatory changes in the EU and could lead to broader market implications as the company transitions its product lines globally.
newTitle: Apple Discontinues iPhone 14 and iPhone SE in EU Due to USB-C Regulations

title: WhatsApp users ALERT! WhatsApp to stop working on these smartphones from...., check full list here - India.com
summary:
WhatsApp to Stop Working on These Smartphones from January 1

Date & Source: December 28, 2024, India.com

WhatsApp Update: American instant messaging and voice-over-IP (VoIP) service WhatsApp is the most popular messaging platform in the world. The company is owned by the technology conglomerate Meta. WhatsApp allows users to send text and multimedia messages and share images, documents, user locations, and other content instantly. The app can be accessed on both smartphones and browsers. Users only need a cellular mobile telephone number to sign up for the app. In addition to individual users, several companies also utilize their services to communicate with employees in real time. WhatsApp’s voice and video calls have revolutionized communication, providing users with the best possible experience.

In a major announcement, WhatsApp has recently made a crucial announcement that directly impacts old smartphone users. The instant messaging app, will no longer be supported on smartphones running Android’s KitKat operating system (OS) or older versions. This major change is going to directly affect people using 9-10 years old phones.

Notably, iPhone users have a deadline of May 2025 to update their older devices.

What Steps Affected Users Can Take?

The affected users, with old phones, want to continue using WhatsApp and need to upgrade to the latest phones with newer operating systems.

Why WhatsApp is phasing out older phones

According to Meta, the decision is part of an effort to maintain security and functionality. With the advancement of the technology, older devices are not able to support new features or protect sensitive data effectively.

Without security patches these devices become prime target of hackers and fall prey to cybercrime. Hence, the company has decided to support those devices that can run up-to-date software.

WhatsApp To Stop Support On These Smartphones

  • Samsung Galaxy S3
  • Motorola Moto G (1st Gen)
  • HTC One X & HTC One X+
  • Sony Xperia Z
  • LG Optimus G
  • LG Nexus 4
  • Sony Xperia T, V, and SP

The Instant Messaging App Will Stop Its Services On Old Apple Devices As Well

Android users will be directly impacted by the immediate cutoff of support, while iPhone users have a bit more room to breathe with a deadline of May 5, 2025, to get their systems up-to-date. Post this date, iPhones operating on iOS 15.1 or earlier won’t be able to get support from WhatsApp. Meaning, those who use iPhone 5s, iPhone 6, and iPhone 6 Plus will be faced with a choice – either get a newer model or update their iOS to stay connected on WhatsApp.
newTitle: WhatsApp to Discontinue Support on Older Phones

title: WhatsApp Web May Soon Introduce Reverse Image Search Feature - Bizz Buzz
Apple discontinues iPhone SE and iPhone 14 as USB-C becomes mandatory charging standard in EU - HT Tech
summary:
Apple Discontinues iPhone SE and iPhone 14 as EU Mandates USB-C Charging Standard

Publication Date: December 28, 2023 Source: Hindustan Times

Introduction

The European Union has implemented USB-C as the mandatory charging standard for electronic devices, pushing companies like Apple to discontinue older models such as the iPhone SE and iPhone 14 in the region.

Key Points

  • The EU's regulation aims to reduce e-waste and simplify charging for consumers.
  • Apple's iPhone SE (3rd generation) and iPhone 14 featured the outdated Lightning connector.
  • The discontinued models will still be available through third-party sellers until stock runs out.
  • A USB-C-equipped iPhone SE is planned for release in early 2025.
  • The regulation may influence global manufacturers to adopt USB-C.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

This change meets the EU's regulatory requirements and responds to consumer demands for a more unified charging standard.

Conclusion

The EU's decision marks a significant change in the smartphone industry, potentially leading to a global standard for charging cables and devices.
newTitle: Apple Discontinues iPhone SE and iPhone 14 as EU Mandates USB-C Charging Standard

Black-eyed peas, or lobia, are a nutrient-dense food perfect for vegan and vegetarian diets, providing essential plant-based protein and fiber.

  • Lobia is versatile, fitting various dishes like soups, salads, and curries.
  • It's a great source of calcium, essential for strong bones in dairy-free diets.
  • Helps stabilize blood sugar levels due to its low glycemic index.
  • Low in calories and high in fiber, aiding in weight management.
  • Rich in antioxidants, reducing oxidative stress and inflammation.
  • Packed with folate vital for cell growth and repair.
  • Contains non-heme iron, crucial for energy levels and preventing anemia.
  • Excellent source of plant-based protein, essential for muscle building.

title: Tech recap 2024: Samsung, Google lead advancements in gen-AI; Apple follows - Business Standard
summary:
Tech Recap 2024: Samsung and Google Lead AI Advancements While Apple Takes a Conservative Approach

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Tech News Daily

In 2024, the mobile technology landscape has notably shifted towards software advancements, primarily driven by Samsung and Google in the realm of artificial intelligence (AI) integration.

  • Samsung has integrated advanced AI functionalities into its Galaxy S24 series, focusing on generative AI tools for image enhancement and real-time language translations.
  • Google has embedded AI deeply in the Android operating system, showcased by its Pixel 9 series with innovative features like Magic Eraser and AI-driven call screening.
  • Apple has taken a more conservative approach, opting for incremental improvements in its iPhone 16 series with a focus on privacy and on-device processing rather than aggressive AI strategies.
  • Samsung and Google are expected to continue their AI momentum into 2025, while Apple's long-term strategy may focus on privacy advantages.
“While Samsung and Google raced ahead with gen-AI, Apple remained relatively conservative.”

In conclusion, the advancements in AI technologies by Samsung and Google set a high standard for the industry, while Apple’s measured approach may offer long-term advantages in security and user privacy.
newTitle: Tech Recap 2024: Samsung and Google Lead AI Advancements While Apple Takes a Conservative Approach

title: Apple discontinues iPhone SE and iPhone 14 as EU officially adopts USB-C as universal charging standard - India Today
summary:
Apple Discontinues iPhone 14 and SE Following EU Adoption of USB-C Standard

Published On: Dec 30, 2024 by: Nandini Yadav

Apple has discontinued the iPhone 14 and iPhone SE in the EU as these models feature the outdated lightning port, while USB-C is now the official charging standard in the region, requiring all electronic devices sold in the EU to adopt this port.

Key Points

  • USB-C became the mandatory standard in the EU on December 28, 2024.
  • Apple's iPhone 14 and iPhone SE are discontinued in the EU to comply with the regulation.
  • Older models with lightning ports will still be available through third-party sellers until stocks last.
  • The regulation aims to reduce e-waste and simplify charging for consumers.
  • Apple is expected to launch a USB-C-equipped iPhone SE in early 2025.

Notable Quote

“Today’s the day! USB-C is officially the common standard for electronic devices in the EU!” - European Commission

This regulation is seen as a significant step towards environmental sustainability and consumer convenience.
newTitle: Apple Discontinues iPhone 14 and SE Following EU Adoption of USB-C Standard

title: Redmi Turbo 4 color variants revealed ahead of January 2 launch - gizmochina

Date & Source: December 29, 2024 - Gizmochina

Introduction: Redmi has confirmed the launch of the Redmi Turbo 4 on Jan. 2, 2025, debuting as the world’s first phone powered by the Dimensity 8400-Ultra chipset. The design of the smartphone has been revealed ahead of the launch.

  1. The Redmi Turbo 4’s rear camera module adopts a vertical 50-megapixel dual-camera setup with red accents.
  2. The back cover features a red line that runs through the frosted matte glass back from top to bottom, giving it a dual-tone finish.
  3. The overall look of the Turbo 4 is reminiscent of the iPhone 16.
  4. The phone is expected to be available in black, white, and blue colors.
  5. The Redmi Turbo 4 is rumored to have a flat display, a 6.67-inch AMOLED screen with a 1.5K resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate, a 20-megapixel front camera, and a 50-megapixel + 8-megapixel dual-camera unit.
  6. The phone will be powered by the Dimensity 8400-Ultra, up to 16 GB of RAM, up to 512 GB of storage, and a 6,550mAh battery with 90W fast charging support.
  7. The Redmi Turbo 4 will run on Android 15 with a layer of HyperOS 2.0 on top.

Notable Quote: “The Turbo 4 is likely to remain exclusive to the Chinese market, but it may get rebranded as the Poco X7 Pro for the global market.”

Conclusion: The upcoming Redmi Turbo 4 promises impressive specifications and a sleek design, set to debut on January 2, 2025.

title: WhatsApp Is Ready To Help You Identify Fake Images Using Google: Here’s How - News18
summary:
WhatsApp Is Ready To Help You Identify Fake Images Using Google: Here’s How

Date: December 30, 2024
Source: News18

WhatsApp is leveraging Google's capabilities to tackle the spread of fake news and misinformation. The messaging app has begun testing reverse image search functionality for both Android and web versions.

  • The new feature aims to help users identify fake content and find the original sources of images shared within chats.
  • This tool is particularly useful for those forwarding unchecked content, which may be dangerous.
  • Users can access the reverse image search via a three-dot menu after selecting an image.
  • The feature ensures that WhatsApp chats remain private, as only the selected content is uploaded to Google.
  • WhatsApp is gradually rolling out this feature and it is expected to reach more users soon.
"WhatsApp has already started beta testing the feature on Android, with plans to expand to web users soon."

This new functionality underscores WhatsApp's commitment to ensuring user safety and combating misinformation in digital communication.
newTitle: WhatsApp Introduces Reverse Image Search Feature to Combat Misinformation
